text: Hey... does someone have an idea on how to change a global module into a non global one?
If you have it on a template there should be an option there to “Make local copy” <@UAXL2G8NL>

Not sure if this has been asked before. How do you deal with clients that complain that <https://domain.com> doesn't go to <https://www.domain.com> -- being that their hosting is at godaddy and doesn't have an SSL cert for it.  

Part 2, I can just get them to get an SSL certificate on it, and then we are done with that problem, correct?

Part 1 of question - forward them to HubSpot Technical support lol.
(I’m joking but, really this should be something HubSpot handles - atleast for HS only sites.) And yes you need to have an ssl cert on the domain and it needs to redirect to the www. version
Let’s Encrypt has free certs you can provision for apex domains if secure apex redirection is important to your clients
i need to check in a form if the input email already exist in my db
theres a way to check the db?

are you storing emails in a HubDB table? or are you just meaning contact records?

as an fyi I would not store email addresses that are not public company addresses in a HubDB.(HubDBs are public, there’s nothing preventing someone from scraping them)
What are you referring to re “db “
Meaning contact record? You could access via the contacts api
